condition.description:
Each spring, summer, and fall, trees, weeds, and grasses release tiny pollen grains into the air. Some of the pollen ends up in your nose and throat. This can trigger a type of allergy called hay fever.

Symptoms can include

  • Sneezing, often with a runny or clogged nose
  • Coughing and postnasal drip
  • Itching eyes, nose and throat
  • Red and watery eyes
  • Dark circles under the eyes

Your health care provider may diagnose hay fever based on a physical exam and your symptoms. Sometimes skin or blood tests are used. Taking medicines and using nasal sprays can relieve symptoms. You can also rinse out your nose, but be sure to use distilled or sterilized water with saline. Allergy shots can help make you less sensitive to pollen and provide long-term relief.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

carousel_items: Don't take it if you have an allergy to aspirin since ibuprofen can cause a similar reaction.
Chlorpheniramine (the antihistamine ingredient in Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief) can make you sleepy, so avoid activities that require you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
While taking this, avoid alcohol and other drugs that make you drowsy.
Phenylephrine (the decongestant ingredient) can make you restless, so don't take it too close to bedtime.
Let your doctor know if your symptoms don't improve in a few days.
Don't use in kids age 12 years or younger.

basics.benefits_moa: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief is a combination medicine that treats cold and allergy symptoms. Ibuprofen is an NSAID that relieves swelling, pain, and fever. Chlorpheniramine is an antihistamine that treats runny nose and watery eyes. Phenylephrine is a decongestant that clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief is an okay combination medicine to relieve pain and congestion. The antihistamine can make you sleepy and the decongestant can keep you awake, so it could affect you either way.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you're taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Phenylephrine doesn't last as long as other decongestants like pseudoephedrine.
You shouldn't use it if you have high blood pressure.
The pain reliever (ibuprofen) can interact with other medications and make health problems like stomach bleeding and ulcers worse.
It's not safe to take ibuprofen if you're pregnant since it increases the risk of heart defects in babies.

upsides: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief is a combination medicine that relieves multiple cold and allergy symptoms. It's good to use if you have a stuffy nose, sinus pressure, and pain.

The decongestant (phenylephrine) has fewer side effects than other decongestants like pseudoephedrine. It doesn't raise your blood pressure and heart rate as much, or cause as much trouble falling asleep.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief contains ibuprofen, which can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief lowers your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief can harm unborn babies. Ibuprofen can increase the risk of a heart defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Lower kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief contains ibuprofen, an NSAID that can lower kidney function or cause damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time lowers your risk. Your doctor should check your kidney function if you take Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief for any amount of time.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Phenylephrine can put additional stress on your heart. Advil Allergy and Congestion Relief also contains ibuprofen, a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It can lower the benefit of low-dose aspirin (81 mg/day) in people taking it to prevent heart attacks and stroke, especially if taking both drugs together for a long time. Be careful when using it if you have a history of heart problems. Talk to your doctor if another option might be better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Advil Allergy Sinus is a combination medicine to treat allergy and cold symptoms. Ibuprofen (an NSAID) relieves swelling, pain, and fever. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses. Chlorpheniramine (an antihistamine) treats nasal allergy symptoms.
basics.bottom_line: Advil Allergy Sinus is good for multiple allergy and cold symptoms, but check to be sure you really need all of its ingredients.
downsides: If you don't really need all of the medications in this combination, you'd be taking extra medicine and can have extra side effects for no reason.
The pain reliever (ibuprofen) can interact with other medications and make health problems like stomach bleeding and ulcers worse.
It's not safe to take ibuprofen if you're pregnant since it increases the risk of heart defects in babies.
Pseudoephedrine, the decongestant in Advil Allergy Sinus, can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Some people who take this medicine are able to stop other asthma medications or use their fast-acting (rescue) inhalers less often.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Starts working the same day, but it can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Replace the cap on the inhaler after each use to protect it from moisture.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after inhaling the medication.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.

Contains lactose, so don't take if you have a milk protein allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Mometasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Mometasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping Mometasone too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Mometasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Mometasone. You should not use Mometasone if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Mometasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Mometasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Mometasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Mometasone, you may need to discuss changing to another drug.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection

Check with your doctor or pharmacist to make sure you know how to use this nose spray correctly.

Some people get a headache or feel drowsy and dizzy after using it.

basics.benefits_moa: Azelastine is an antihistamine nasal spray. It works directly in your nose to block histamine, a chemical that causes runny nose, itching, and sneezing.
basics.bottom_line: Azelastine is a prescription-only antihistamine nasal spray that can help with your allergy or nasal symptoms without exposing the rest of your body to the medicine.
downsides: In older versions of the medicine, you can get a bitter taste in your mouth after spraying it into your nose.
Can cause nose bleeds if the spray nozzle is inserted into your nose wrongly.
Need a prescription to get Azelastine.
It's good for 200 sprays, but there isn't a counter to help you keep track of sprays.

carousel_items: Take it as needed every 4 to 6 hours.
Benadryl can make you dehydrated, so avoid this side effect by drinking plenty of fluids.
Benadryl makes you tired, so take it before you go to sleep.

If you only have itchy or watery eyes, try using just an antihistamine eye drop.

basics.benefits_moa: Benadryl is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. It also makes you sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Benadryl is great for allergies, but curl up on the couch after taking it and get ready for a nap.
downsides: Benadryl makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Benadryl until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Benadryl to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Benadryl.
Don't use Benadryl if you are breastfeeding.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: There are a variety of over-the-counter medications with the same ingredients as Benadryl. It's not safe to use more than one medication containing diphenhydramine (the ingredient in Benadryl) at the same time. Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.
risk_factors: Using other drugs with the same ingredients

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 years and older have a higher risk of side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Benadryl. Watch for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. The drowsiness caused by Benadryl can make you "unsteady" on your feet, leading to a higher chance of falls.

basics.benefits_moa: Brotapp is a combination medicine that relieves allergy and cold symptoms. Brompheniramine (an antihistamine) treats runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes or skin. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Brotapp is okay for treating congestion, but it could make you really tired or keep you wide awake.
downsides: If you don't need both of the medications in this combination, you'd be taking extra medicine and can have extra side effects for no reason.
Pseudoephedrine (the decongestant) can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
Brompheniramine (the antihistamine) can make you dizzy and drowsy. It could increase the risk of falls for elderly people.
The two ingredients in this medication can make you either really tired or keep you wide awake. See how it affects you before doing anything important.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Brotapp can harm an unborn baby. Brompheniramine, the antihistamine, can hurt your baby if you take it during the last three months of your pregnancy (last trimester). Pseudoephedrine, the decongestant, is harmful if taken during first 3 months (first trimester). It can be safer to use a nasal decongestant spray. Talk with your doctor about what's best while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Brotapp and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

basics.benefits_moa: Claritin D is a combination medicine for allergies. Loratadine (an antihistamine) prevents allergy symptoms like runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes or skin. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Claritin D relieves allergies and congestion without causing daytime sleepiness. It can keep you up at night if you take it too close to bedtime.
downsides: You can have more side effects when using combination pills than when using single-ingredient medications.
The decongestant (Pseudoephedrine) can make your heart race or give you anxious or restless feelings.
You might not sleep as well due to Pseudoephedrine's effects and you can also have strange dreams while taking it.
Pseudoephedrine can raise your blood pressure, so don't take it if you have high blood pressure or other heart conditions.
Although you don't need a prescription, you do need to show a photo ID to buy this from behind the pharmacy counter.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Claritin D.  Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet.  This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Claritin D and stop using it if you have side effects.

basics.benefits_moa: Dimetapp Cold and Allergy is a combination medicine that relieves allergy and cold symptoms. Brompheniramine (an antihistamine) prevents allergy symptoms like runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes or skin. Phenylephrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Dimetapp Cold and Allergy is good for multiple nasal symptoms, but it can make you really drowsy.
downsides: If you don't really need both of the medications in this combination, you'd be taking extra medicine and might have extra side effects for no reason.
Brompheniramine (the antihistamine) can cause dizziness, drowsiness, dry eyes/mouth, and constipation.
Phenylephrine (the decongestant) doesn't last as long as other oral decongestants like pseudoephedrine, but can cause jitteriness.
The two medications in this medicine can somewhat work against each other, with one making you sleepy and the other making you jittery.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Dimetapp Cold and Allergy can harm unborn babies. Brompheniramine can increase the risk of a birth defect in an unborn baby if you take it during the last 3 months of pregnancy (last trimester). Phenylephrine can also be unsafe to take during the first 3 months of pregnancy (first trimester). Instead, it's safer to use a decongestant nasal spray for up to 3 days. Talk with your doctor or pharmacist about what's safe and will work best for you while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: People taking Dimetapp Cold and Allergy and MAO inhibitors together, or up to 14 days apart from each other, can experience very high blood pressure that can cause headaches and strokes. MAOI drugs are used to treat Parkinson's disease, depression, and other emotional conditions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you're taking MAO inhibitors and still want to use a cough medicine.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a nasal steroid. It works directly in your nose to reduce swelling and inflammation caused by allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is a good first-choice medicine for treating a runny or stuffy nose caused by allergies, and it's cheaper than some alternatives.
downsides: Fluticasone doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Needs to be primed (pressed/pumped until a fine spray appears) up to six times prior to using it for the first time, or if you haven't used it in 2 weeks.
Since the medicine in Fluticasone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.
Available as a generic medication.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Fluticasone can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. risks_warnings.title: Reduced immune system
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Fluticasone may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.
risk_factors: Exposure to immunizable diseases (chickenpox and measles)

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Fluticasone may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Fluticasone before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Fluticasone before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Fluticasone.

carousel_items: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Can take 2 weeks or more to feel full effects.
Pump the inhaler 4 times before your first dose, or if it's been more than 7 days since your last dose.
Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

basics.benefits_moa: Fluticasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Fluticasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Fluticasone every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Available as both an inhaler and Diskus device.

Wait at least 1 minute between doses.
Rinse your out mouth with water after each use.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after using Advair Diskus.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Diskus contains lactose, so don't use it if you're allergic to milk protein.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Fluticasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

description_processed.orig: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Fluticasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs with Fluticasone Diskus after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Fluticasone. You should not use Fluticasone Diskus if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

description_processed.orig: People who use drugs like Fluticasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Fluticasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Fluticasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Fluticasone, you may need to discuss other medications that will treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

description_processed.orig: Inhaled steroid medications like Fluticasone can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Fluticasone.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: Fluticasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Fluticasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems

risk_factors: History of high internal eye pressure

carousel_items: Use Triamcinolone once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

basics.benefits_moa: Triamcinolone is a nasal steroid. It works directly in your nose to help reduce swelling and inflammation from allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Triamcinolone is the only medication in its class available over the counter for treating stuffy and runny nose due to allergies. You have to use it every day for it to work.
downsides: Can't be used on as-needed basis. Must be taken every day.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left.
Since the medicine in Triamcinolone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.
Needs to be primed before use and re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.

downsides_processed.orig: Can't be used on as-needed basis. Must be taken every day.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left.
Since the medicine in Triamcinolone is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.
Needs to be primed before use and re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.

upsides: Available over the counter without a prescription.
First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression
risks_warnings.description: Switching from oral or injectable steroids to inhaled, especially if used for an extended amount of time, can cause withdrawal symptoms, including joint or muscle pain, lack of energy and depression. This can be worsened if you are under stress or if the change in steroid dose happens too quickly. Your doctor will work with you if this is a concern.

basics.benefits_moa: Nasonex is a topical steroid. It works directly where it's applied to help reduce swelling and inflammation in your nose.
basics.bottom_line: Nasonex is a good first-choice treatment for stuffy and runny noses caused by allergies, but it's not available as a generic so it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

carousel_items: Use daily to control your asthma symptoms.
Starts working the same day, but it can take up 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Pump the inhaler 2 times before inhaling the first dose, or if it's been more than 10 days since your last dose.
Wait one minute between doses.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Clean the mouthpiece with dry cloth once a week.
Talk to your doctor if asthma symptoms don't get better.

basics.benefits_moa: Qvar is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Qvar is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You have to use Qvar every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Qvar every day to control your symptoms.
You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.

I wish that I had known it works by lowering the immune system since I already have a weak immune system problem.
Sore throat, swollen lymph nodes, headaches and worsened breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Qvar too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Qvar.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Qvar too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Qvar.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Qvar for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Qvar if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

description_processed.orig: People who use drugs like Qvar for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: Qvar may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Qvar. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

description_processed.orig: Qvar may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Qvar. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Qvar. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Qvar, you may need to discuss changing to another drug.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Qvar. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Qvar can decrease growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Qvar.

carousel_items: Works best if used everyday. It takes about one week to start seeing the best results.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist to make sure you know how to use this nose spray correctly.
Shake the spray gently and clear your nose before each use.
Before using it for the first time or if you haven't used it in 2 days, prime the spray pump until you see a fine mist.
Breathe in slowly as you're spraying and tilt your head back slightly after spraying. Wait 15 minutes before blowing your nose if needed.
Some people get minor nose irritation, nosebleeds, sore throat, or headaches after using it.

basics.benefits_moa: Budesonide is a steroid nasal spray that works directly in your nose to reduce swelling and allergy symptoms.
basics.bottom_line: Budesonide is a steroid nasal spray that works best when used regularly for your nasal allergy symptoms.
downsides: Needs to be used everyday to work, so it can't be used as needed.
Can hace an unpleasant smell or taste.
It's good for 120 sprays, but there isn't a counter to help you keep track of sprays.
Can't be used in kids younger than age 6 years.
Need a prescription to get Budesonide.

downsides_processed.orig: Needs to be used everyday to work, so it can't be used as needed.

Can't be used in kids younger than age 6 years.
Need a prescription to get Budesonide.

upsides: Budesonide lowers the number of nasal symptoms you'll get during allergy season.
Most people don't have many side effects since it works in the nose and doesn't affect the rest of your body.
Doesn't make you drowsy or dizzy.

risks_warnings.title: Changes to your nose
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Budesonide can increase your risk of changes in the bony cartilage between your nostrils (nasal septum). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you need to be on Budesonide for a long time.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Budesonide can increase your risk of changes in the bony cartilage between your nostrils (nasal septum). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you need to be on Budesonide for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Poor wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma to your nose or sinuses, taking Budesonide before your body has healed can lower your body's ability to heal itself.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma to your nose or sinuses, taking Budesonide before your body has healed can lower your body's ability to heal itself.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of infections
risks_warnings.description: Budesonide can lower your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat, and lungs. The risk is lower with nasal sprays than it is with steroid pills. To be safe, make sure you're up to date on all of your vaccinations and tell your doctor if you have an unexplained fever or weakness that won't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Glaucoma and cataracts
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Budesonide can increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: You can get withdrawal symptoms, like joint or muscle pain, lack of energy, and depression when getting off of Budesonide. Work with your doctor to slowly lower your dose if you've been using it for a long time.

description_processed.orig: You can get withdrawal symptoms, like joint or muscle pain, lack of energy, and depression when getting off of Budesonide. Work with your doctor to slowly lower your dose if you've been using it for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Decrease in growth in children and teenagers
risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can experience delayed growth. The risk is greater if people use Budesonide more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

basics.benefits_moa: Montelukast is a leukotriene inhibitor. It lowers inflammation in your lungs and nasal passages to prevent asthma and relieve allergies.
basics.bottom_line: Montelukast has fewer side effects but doesn't work as well as steroid inhalers for asthma. It also helps with allergies.
downsides: You have to use Montelukast every day to control your symptoms.
Somewhat less effective than corticosteroid inhalers for asthma.
There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.
Can cause behavior changes, agitation, aggression, and difficulty sleeping for some people.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to use Montelukast every day to control your symptoms.

There's no generic available, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Prevents symptoms and improves lung function in children and adults with chronic asthma.
A single 10 mg dose improves exercise-induced asthma symptoms for up to 24 hours.
Fewer side effects compared to other asthma treatments.
Also relieves nasal allergy symptoms.
Effective pill alternative to corticosteroid inhalers.

userStories.tip: I was using many years. In 2005 I had a bleeding episode that could have been a side effect. in 2012 I had my first seizure and decided to read all my med labels. I quit Singular that day.

My daughter was prescribed Singulair when she was six. Horrible side effects to mental and cognitive functioning. Learned after the fact some singular has similar effects on other kids. Parents beware.
I can't take inhaled corticosteroids to control my asthma. This has worked quite well meanwhile..

I wish I hadn't let the fear of the depression side effect prevent me from taking singular for so long,  it works where inhalers do not work for me, and it controls my asthma well in generic montelukast form or Singulair form.
Don't skip a day because it isn't fast acting.  My cat allergies act up for days after being near a cat.

My insurance refuses to cover Singulair, but the generic form doesn't seem to control my asthma as well. One of my pharmacists told me this was the case for himself as well, and that generic was better just for allergies. Singulair is $$$
Caused major depression and angry outbursts which is very unusual for me. I ended up taking half dosage along with St Johns Wort to balance.

For the first several months I did not follow the instructions and took it in the morning (alongside Allegra, Zyrtec, whatever I was using at the time). Now I take it at night and it's far more effective for managing asthma symptoms.
Works perfectly without any side effect, just one pill before going to bed.
I take it at night, along with 2 puffs of Symbicort 80/4.5mcg

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take it once a day to control asthma and allergy symptoms.
If you're using it for asthma or allergies, take it in the evening.
Use it 2 hours before exercising.
Granules can be taken by mouth or dissolved in liquid or soft food.
Doesn't treat sudden wheezing or asthma attacks once they start. Keep a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you.
The chewable tablets contain aspartame, so don't use them if you have a sensitivity to phenylalanine or phenylketones.

risks_warnings.title: Sudden onset of asthma
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Montelukast is not used to treat sudden wheezing or asthma attack. You should have a fast-acting (rescue) inhaler with you all the time especially if you are prone to asthma during exercise. Talk to you doctor if your symptoms do not improve or seem to worsen while taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Aggression and agitation
risks_warnings.description: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. Symptoms range from irritability and memory problems to hallucinations and suicidal thinking. It is not clear if this is linked to history of these conditions. Get medical help immediately if you notice symptoms of agitation, aggression, sleep disturbance, or suicidal thoughts while taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: Rare cases of behavior changes occur in adults and children taking Montelukast. Symptoms range from irritability and memory problems to hallucinations and suicidal thinking. It is not clear if this is linked to history of these conditions. Get medical help immediately if you notice symptoms of agitation, aggression, sleep disturbance, or suicidal thoughts while taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorder (eosinophilia)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of a blood disorder in people taking Montelukast. It's not clear what the link is between this blood vessel condition and Montelukast. Talk to your doctor if you notice red patches/rash or skin color changes on lower legs, numbness/tingling, or worsening of your asthma symptoms. You may need to stop taking Montelukast.

description_processed.orig: There are reports of a blood disorder in people taking Montelukast. It's not clear what the link is between this blood vessel condition and Montelukast. Talk to your doctor if you notice red patches/rash or skin color changes on lower legs, numbness/tingling, or worsening of your asthma symptoms. You may need to stop taking Montelukast.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage from too much phenylalanine
risks_warnings.description: Montelukast contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

description_processed.orig: Montelukast contains aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU, don't use this product.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of liver injury in people taking Montelukast mostly in combination with other factors such as drugs, alcohol, and liver disease. If you have any of these risk factors, your doctor will need to check your liver function periodically.
risk_factors: History of liver disease including hepatitis
Other medications that cause liver injury

basics.benefits_moa: Sudafed is a decongestant. It narrows blood vessels and reduces swelling in your nasal passages to make breathing easier.
basics.bottom_line: Sudafed relieves stuffy nose, but it could keep you up at night. Don't forget your photo ID or you won't be able to buy it in the drugstore.
downsides: Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) can make your heart race or make you feel anxious and restless.
It can affect the quality of your sleep, so you can't take it too close to going to bed.
Can raise blood pressure so check with your doctor before using it if you have high blood pressure or other heart conditions.
Sudafed isn't as effective after using it for more than 4 days straight.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Sudafed works by narrowing blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Sudafed might not be the best option for you.

description_processed.orig: Sudafed works by narrowing blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Sudafed might not be the best option for you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: The stimulant effect of Sudafed can make your heart work harder than it can handle. Be careful if you have a history of heart conditions. Talk to your doctor to find out if another option might be better for you.

description_processed.orig: The stimulant effect of Sudafed can make your heart work harder than it can handle. Be careful if you have a history of heart conditions. Talk to your doctor to find out if another option might be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus

carousel_items: Take Unisom at bedtime as needed if you're 12 years of age or older.
Unisom can make you dehydrated, so avoid this side effect by drinking plenty of fluids.
Don't take it with alcohol or other drugs that make you sleepy.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor. A different medication might work better for you long-term.
Unisom comes in two different generic forms, doxylamine (Unisom SleepTabs) and diphenhydramine (other Unisom products). Both are antihistamines that help you sleep.

basics.benefits_moa: Unisom is an antihistamine. It blocks histamine, a chemical that causes congestion, itching, and other allergic reactions. It also makes you sleepy.
basics.bottom_line: Unisom is a good over-the-counter medication for nighttime allergies.
downsides: Unisom makes you more tired than Claritin, Allegra, or Zyrtec.
You shouldn't drive after taking Unisom until you know how it affects you.
Talk to a pediatrician before giving Unisom to a child.
It can increase the risk of falls, so elderly people shouldn't use Unisom.
Don't use Unisom if you are breastfeeding.

It makes you sleepy, so it'll help if your allergies are bothering you at night.
The effects wear off in 4 to 6 hours, so side effects don't last that long.
It comes as a tablet, capsule, liquid, and quick dissolving tablet.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose

Read package labels carefully to make sure you take the right dose of these medications.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: Levocetirizine is processed by the kidney. If you have kidney problems, you may need a different dose to prevent increased risk for side effects. Don't use Levocetirizine if you have end-stage renal disease or are on hemodialysis. Children ages 6 months to 11 years with kidney problems shouldn't use Levocetirizine.

risks_warnings.title: Increased side effects
risks_warnings.description: People age 65 and older have a higher risk of troublesome side effects from taking antihistamine medications like Levocetirizine. Watch out for changes in vision, severe dry mouth, trouble urinating, or constipation. Also, feelings of drowsiness may leave you "unsteady" on your feet. This can make you more likely to fall causing broken bones or other serious injuries. Talk with your doctor before using Levocetirizine and stop using it if you have side effects.

carousel_items: Starts working in 30 minutes.
You need to show an ID to buy Zyrtec D in the drugstore because it contains Pseudoephedrine.
Don't cut, crush, or chew tablets; swallow them whole.
It's better to take Zyrtec D early in the morning or when you wake up, otherwise you can have trouble sleeping later.
Can cause an irregular or fast heartbeat, and can raise your blood pressure.
If you need to use it for more than a few weeks, talk with your doctor since a different medication might work better for you.

basics.benefits_moa: Zyrtec D is a combination medicine for allergies. Cetirizine (an antihistamine) prevents allergy symptoms like runny nose, sneezing, and itchy eyes or skin. Pseudoephedrine (a decongestant) clears your sinuses.
basics.bottom_line: Zyrtec D relieves allergies and congestion without causing daytime sleepiness. It can keep you up at night if you take it too close to bedtime.
downsides: You can have more side effects when using combination pills than when using single-ingredient medications.
The antihistamine (Cetirizine) can cause more drowsiness than similar antihistamines, like Allegra D (which contains Fexofenadine) and Claritin D (which contains Loratadine).
The decongestant (Pseudoephedrine) can make your heart race or give you anxious or restless feelings.
You might not sleep as well due to Pseudoephedrine's effects and you can also have strange dreams while taking it.
Pseudoephedrine can raise your blood pressure, so don't take it if you have high blood pressure or other heart conditions.
Although you don't need a prescription, you do need to show a photo ID to buy this from behind the pharmacy counter.

upsides: The antihistamine (Cetirizine) in Zyrtec D causes less drowsiness than other medications like Benadryl.
The decongestant (Pseudoephedrine) in Zyrtec D is stronger than other decongestants. It can also help relieve congestion-related headaches and ear pressure.
The stimulant effects of Pseudoephedrine can give you some extra energy during the day.
Doesn't give you rebound congestion (worse congestion symptoms after you stop taking the medicine) like decongestant nose sprays can.
It's available without a prescription, unlike other strong allergy medicines.

risks_warnings.description: Zyrtec D can make it easier for your brain to have a seizure. For most people this won't be a problem. If you have a history of seizures or epilepsy you should avoid using Zyrtec D and talk to your doctor for a safer option that would be better for you.

Contains lactose, so don't take if you have a milk protein allergy.

basics.benefits_moa: Mometasone is a corticosteroid. It lowers inflammation in your lungs, which controls asthma and prevents asthma attacks.
basics.bottom_line: Mometasone is good at controlling and preventing asthma symptoms when you take it every day.
downsides: You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

downsides_processed.orig: You can't lower the dose or stop taking it too suddenly.
Steroids can slow height growth in kids.
Because steroids suppress your immune system, you can catch bacterial and viral infections easier, and they can take longer to go away.
Can cause new or worsening eye pressure, glaucoma, and cataracts.

upsides: Relieves symptoms and improves control of asthma.
People report fewer asthma symptoms and better lung function when they take it every day.

Inhaling this medicine (rather than taking an oral steroid) gets more into the lungs and less into rest of your body, which lowers the risk of side effects. Inhaled corticosteroids can be used safely for years compared to oral corticosteroids like prednisone.
Some people who take this medicine are able to stop other asthma medications or use their fast-acting (rescue) inhalers less often.

userStories.tip: I have had elevated pressure in my eyes while on this drug. That is a known side effect. I worry about the potential for atrophy of the vocal ligament because of the likely deposit of some medicine within the larynx while inhaling.
No side effects other than you cannot stop taking it our you will wheeze. I have no asthma while on this at all and rarely get chest colds now.

drugs.name: Asmanex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use it every day to control your asthma symptoms.
Starts working the same day, but it can take 1 to 2 weeks to feel the full effects.
Rinse your mouth out with water after each use.
Replace the cap on the inhaler after each use to protect it from moisture.
Hold your breath for 10 seconds after inhaling the medication.
Don't breathe out into the inhaler mouthpiece.
Tell your doctor if the medication stops working or if your symptoms get worse.
Contains lactose, so don't take if you have a milk protein allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Adrenal suppression (HPA axis suppression)
risks_warnings.description: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Mometasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Mometasone.
risk_factors: Lowering dose or stopping Mometasone too quickly especially after long-term treatment
Stress such as trauma, surgery or infection

description_processed.orig: Adrenal suppression can occur if you lower your dose or stop taking Mometasone too quickly. Symptoms include joint or muscle pain, extreme low energy and depression. Changes in your medication need to be done slowly and over time. Talk to your doctor before you decrease or stop Mometasone.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Severe allergic reactions have been reported in people taking Mometasone who have severe milk protein allergy. This reaction occurs after inhaling the powder which contains lactose. Call 911 or your doctor right away if you develop severe rash, itching, swelling or difficulty breathing while taking Mometasone. You should not use Mometasone if you are tested or know about this allergy.

You should not use Mometasone if you are tested or know about this allergy.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk for bacterial and viral infection
risks_warnings.description: People who use drugs like Mometasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. It may take longer to fight these infections and they can be more serious. Talk to your doctor before taking Mometasone if you have not had vaccinations against certain viral diseases.
risk_factors: Bacterial or viral infection not being treated
Not vaccinated against chickenpox or measles

description_processed.orig: People who use drugs like Mometasone for a long time may be at higher risk to catch bacterial and viral infections. risks_warnings.title: Difficulty breathing (bronchospasm)
risks_warnings.description: There are reports of difficulty breathing (bronchospasm) after inhaling Mometasone. Call 911 or your doctor right away if a fast-acting asthma inhaler does not stop the attack. Talk to you doctor if your asthma worsens while taking Mometasone, you may need to discuss changing to another drug.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced growth rate in children
risks_warnings.description: Inhaled steroid medications like Mometasone can reduce growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Mometasone.

description_processed.orig: Inhaled steroid medications like Mometasone can reduce growth rate in children. Your doctor will use the lowest possible dose to control asthma symptoms and will monitor height during while taking Mometasone.

risks_warnings.title: Mouth and throat infection
risks_warnings.description: Mometasone may cause a fungal infection of the mouth and throat called thrush. Tell your doctor if you notice white patches inside your mouth or throat or have difficulty swallowing while taking Mometasone. Your doctor can prescribe medication to treat the infection.

risks_warnings.title: Eye problems

carousel_items: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

basics.benefits_moa: Nasonex is a topical steroid. It works directly where it's applied to help reduce swelling and inflammation in your nose.
basics.bottom_line: Nasonex is a good first-choice treatment for stuffy and runny noses caused by allergies, but it's not available as a generic so it can be expensive.
downsides: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

downsides_processed.orig: Only available as a brand name medication, so it can be expensive.
Needs to be primed 10 times before it can be used, or re-primed if not used for more than 2 weeks.
Doesn't have a counter on it, so it can be hard to remember how many sprays are left (each bottle has 120 sprays).
Since the medicine in Nasonex is a steroid, it can slow down your healing process if you've hurt your nose or had nose surgery.

upsides: First-choice medication for treating runny and stuffy noses caused by allergies. It works by reducing inflammation in the nose.
Because it's used directly where the inflammation is happening, it has fewer side effects than oral steroids do and has a lower chance of causing withdrawal symptoms once the medication is stopped.
Can be used as needed to help control symptoms in people age 13 years or older.

drugs.name: Nasonex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Use Nasonex once a day, following age-specific recommendations on how many sprays to use. Don't take more than prescribed.
Blow your nose before using.
Can cause thrush (a fungal infection) inside the nose and throat.
Can also cause nosebleeds, a sore throat, and headaches.
Needs to be used regularly during allergy season for it to work. It can take 1 to 2 weeks for the medicine to start working fully.
Check with your doctor or pharmacist on how to use the nasal spray the right way.
Shake well before using it. Before the first use, prime the bottle by spraying it until you see a fine mist.

risks_warnings.title: Thrush in the nose and throat
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of getting thrush in the nose and throat. Your doctor will check your nose and throat if you have to be on this medication for a long time. Also, tell your doctor if you notice pain in the nose and throat with redness and white patches.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in the nasal septum
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex can increase your chances of having changes in the nasal septum (the bony cartilage between your nostrils). Your doctor will check your nose regularly if you have to be on this medication for a long time.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased wound healing
risks_warnings.description: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.
risk_factors: Surgery or trauma to the nose or sinuses

description_processed.orig: If you've recently had surgery, ulcers, or trauma in your nose or sinuses, taking Nasonex before your body has healed can reduce your body's ability to heal itself. Your doctor will make sure that you have healed adequately before starting or restarting Nasonex.

risks_warnings.title: Glaucoma and cataracts
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may increase your chances of having glaucoma or cataracts. If you notice changes in your vision, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Reduced immune system
risks_warnings.description: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.
risk_factors: Exposure to immunizable diseases (chickenpox and measles)

description_processed.orig: Long-term use of Nasonex may reduce your body's ability to fight infection, especially in the nose, throat and lungs. Tell your doctor if you've been exposed to tuberculosis or you need to be immunized.

risks_warnings.title: Decrease in growth in children and teenagers
risks_warnings.description: Children and teenagers who are on this medication for a long period of time can have slowed growth. The risk is greater if people use more than the prescribed amount. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.
